STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 10, 2024
Martha Christine Brail
Keane Center for Adoption
933 N Melborn St.
Dearborn, MI, 48128-1784
RE: License#: CB820201219
Dear Ms. Brail:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 12/9/2024. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Lonia Perry Calloway, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Nothing this inspection
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12205(7) Required staff & R400.12605(1) Adoptive family assessment:
• The agency was provided consultation related to the rules and how it shall
document clear and consistent compliance at all times.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The agency submitted a chief administrator’s report dated 11/15/2024. The
agency had no rule violations during its last inspection in 2023.The chief
administrator’s report indicated that, and that the agency had no disrupted
placements. Not documented in the report but indicated by the chief administrator
were frustrations related to difficulties and barriers pertaining to CWLM. The chief
administrator continues to work with the helpdesk to try to get barriers worked out
or through, so as to gain access.

Financial Overview
The agency provided a 2024 program budget. No concerns were observed with
that document. The agency is a very small adoption agency, and it has received a
variance with respect to not being required to submit an annual independent
financial audit.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A discussion was had with the chief administrator and the adoption
supervisor/worker during the inspection. With the exception of them reporting that
one of its two contractual workers is no longer employed with agency, neither
reported any significant changes or concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A tour of the agency did not review any concerns. The agency continues to store
and secure all files, and it has sufficient space and equipment for its two full time
staff.
VII. DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This is not an agency who has a contract with the department.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
December 9, 2024
_____________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
